title: Advancing Post-Consumer Textile Recycling: Emerging Technologies Shaping Sustainable Fashion - Fibre2fashion.com
summary: The textile industry is under pressure to adopt sustainable technologies due to its considerable environmental impact, prompting innovations in chemical recycling techniques for fibers like cotton and synthetic materials. Stricter EU waste legislation and increasing public awareness are driving manufacturers to shift from incinerating unsold garments to adopting recycling practices. Although only 20% of textile waste is recycled, advancements in both mechanical and chemical recycling methods are being developed to create high-quality post-consumer materials while addressing the challenges of diverse material compositions. New sorting technologies like Fibersort aim to improve the recycling process, contributing towards a circular economy in fashion.
